content:
The LED is probably the simplest form of output available and the micro:bit has a display of 25 red LEDs for you to program. The LEDs are arranged in a 5x5 grid allowing it to display patterns, images, letters, or numbers.
The `ledScreen` can help you...
Express how you feel!
Make animals!
Make a name badge!
## Useful Commands with the LED Screen - [`ledScreen.on()`(#f78183)](/docs/ide/applab/expressions/ledScreen.on) - [`ledScreen.off()`(#f78183)](/docs/ide/applab/expressions/ledScreen.off) - [`ledScreen.toggle()`(#f78183)](/docs/ide/applab/expressions/ledScreen.toggle) - [`ledScreen.clear()`(#f78183)](/docs/ide/applab/expressions/ledScreen.clear) - [`ledScreen.display()`(#f78183)](/docs/ide/applab/expressions/ledScreen.display) - [`ledScreen.scrollString()`(#f78183)](/docs/ide/applab/expressions/ledScreen.scrollString) - [`ledScreen.scrollNumber()`(#f78183)](/docs/ide/applab/expressions/ledScreen.scrollNumber)
